title: Pomegranate Cornbread Stuffing
summary: Pomegranate Cornbread Stuffing is a dairy free side dish. One serving contains 120 calories, 3g of protein, and 2g of fat. This recipe serves 18 and costs 37 cents per serving. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Thanksgiving. A mixture of arils from 1 pomegranate, raisins, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. This recipe is typical of Southern cuisine. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 41%. This score is solid. Try Pomegranate Cornbread Stuffing, Cornbread Stuffing, and Cornbread Stuffing for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel are great choices for Southern. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. One wine you could try is Maximin Grunhaus Abtsberg Riesling Kabinett. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 42 dollars.
